activities.loc: Branch 1 - Hearing by Zoom.  See enclosed information.

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 8, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

[ma] Case called at 1:34 PM {This hearing is being conducted via Zoom videoconferencing.} 
Defendant Joseph John Sallaz appeared by zoom.  Attorney May Y Lee appeared by zoom for Joseph John Sallaz.  Attorney Monica Hall in court for State of Wisconsin. 

The Court finds that the Zoom video conferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Atty Lee indicates that reports requested from DOJ were received late yesterday, have other discovery inquires. Additionally, Atty Lee intends to file a Motion to Suppress. 

Scheduling is discussed. 
recess: 1:38pm 
NEXT: Status on 12/8/22 at 2:30pm via zoom
Status conference on November 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on October 21, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

[ma] Case called at 2:23 PM {This hearing is being conducted via Zoom videoconferencing.} 
Defendant Joseph John Sallaz appeared by zoom.  Attorney May Y Lee appeared by zoom for Joseph John Sallaz.  Attorney Monica Hall in court for State of Wisconsin. 
DA Hall verifies victim rights compliance.

Zoom appearances are permitted. 
recess: 2:27pm 
NEXT: Status on 10/21/22 at 2:30pm via zoom
Status conference on September 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

[MK] case called at 2:30pm 
Defendant Joseph John Sallaz in court with Attorney May Y Lee.  ADA Jeffrey Shock in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Mr. Sallaz waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial. Attorney Lee preserves the right to request speedy trial
Attorney Lee indicates that she is looking into a possible collateral attack motion; she is awaiting receipts of records.  
recess 2:39pm 

NEXT: Status Conference on September 22nd at 1:30pm with appearances of the Defendant and Defense counsel by Zoom conference

Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

[ml] Case called at 1:28PM
Defendant Joseph John Sallaz appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Cassi Nelson (PD appears for bond-purposes only; eval declined). Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

Att Nelson verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
The Court gives right to counsel. The Court tolls Preliminary Hearing time limits, preserves the Defendant's jurisdictional objections, and sets this matter over for an Adjourned Initial Appearance.

The Court requires a $5,000.00 Signature Bond with conditions:
--no operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license
--maintain absolute sobriety
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--the Defendant is to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  The Court orders the defendant to SCRAM monitoring through WCS, with the consideration of Remote Breath as an alternative only when WCS verifies that a defendant's work environment or health condition prohibits the SCRAM bracelet.

The Defendant is to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees. **If in custody, release on SCRAM only.**
recess 1:45PM

NEXT: Adjourned Initial Appearance (also Status of Counsel) on 08/01 at 8:30AM with in person appearances
